meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a heavy club or similar weapon.
meanings.sent1: The criminal bludgeoned the door with a hammer to break it open.
meanings.sent2: The caveman bludgeoned the animal with a large rock for food.
meanings.sent3: The chef bludgeoned the dough to make the perfect bread loaf.
meanings.sent4: The waves bludgeoned the shore relentlessly during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The boxer bludgeoned his opponent with powerful punches in the ring.

meanings.definition: To beat or strike repeatedly with a blunt object.
meanings.sent1: The bully bludgeoned the smaller kid with his fists in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjack bludgeoned the tree stump to split it into pieces.
meanings.sent3: The comedian bludgeoned the audience with jokes until they couldn't stop laughing.
meanings.sent4: The rain bludgeoned the roof all night, keeping everyone awake.
meanings.sent5: The drummer bludgeoned the drums with passion during the concert performance.
